meanings.definition: To be under a curse or spell.
meanings.sent1: The old castle was becursed by an evil sorcerer.
meanings.sent2: She felt becursed after accidentally breaking the mirror.
meanings.sent3: The cat becursed the house with its mischievous antics.
meanings.sent4: The town was becursed by a never-ending storm.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tomb was becursed with a powerful enchantment.

meanings.sent1: The becursed amulet brought misfortune to all who possessed it.
meanings.sent2: The villagers avoided the becursed forest at all costs.
meanings.sent3: The becursed pirate ship was said to bring bad luck to anyone who boarded it.
meanings.sent4: The becursed land lay barren and desolate, devoid of life.
meanings.sent5: The becursed painting seemed to watch anyone who entered the room.
